translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Sudhā
“In the past I was a hunter
As if face-to-face with the Buddha,
After paying homage to the pāṭali,
I made offerings to the Bodhi Tree;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Bodhi Tree.
was the name of thirteen kings;
there will be a powerful Universal Monarch.
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Tipupphiya recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā tipupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Tipupphiyattherassāpadānaṁ chaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā tipupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽tipupphiya therassa apadānam chaṭṭha
translated: The Elder Tipupphiya’s Birth Story, the sixth.
